page.title: 15The Fortune Centre.
page.content: The Fortune Centre, which seeks to train and rehabilitate handicapped and disturbed young people through riding and allied activities has part of its impressive facilities at Wootton Hall on the edge of the New Forest. The idea for the centre was conceived by the Hon. Mrs P.C. Baillie and Mrs Y. Nelson and opened in 1981. Each week more than 100 children and young people whose handicaps range from severe mental and physical to social deprivation visit the centre free of charge. Training courses for R.D.A. voluntary helpers are also run. Residential rehabilitation courses are available for lesser handicapped students or those suffering from temporary emotional disorders who wish to train as assistants in equestrian fields. The centre also runs a 3 year course for the training of therapists.
